subject: Photography
title: Depth of Field Explained
description: A quick, practical guide to Depth of Field Explained.

hook.text: Only one distance is truly in focus. But a zone around it looks sharp enough. That zone is depth of field.

buildup.text: Depth of field depends on aperture, focal length, and distance to the subject. Change any one, the zone changes.

discovery.text: Wide aperture equals shallow depth of field â€” blurry backgrounds. Small aperture equals deep â€” most things sharp.

twist.text: Depth of field isn't symmetrical. The sharp zone extends farther behind the focus point than in front of it.

climax.text: Controlling depth of field is one of photography's most powerful creative tools. It directs the viewer's eye.

punchline.text: Focus is where you look. Blur is everything else.

quiz.question: What creates a shallow depth of field with blurry backgrounds?
